Mean magnetic declination (MD) 20º 31’ west of true north (1998.10)
Mean annual change (AC) 4’ westwards (1995–2001)
MD
TN
MN
Calculate the magnetic bearing from trig. beacon 8 to spot height 120 for 2012.
MB = TB + MD
TB = 57° (56°– 58°)
MD = 20°31’ W of TN
AC = 4’ W
2012 – 1998 = 14 years 
14 × 4’ W = 56’ W
MD = 20° 31’ W + 56’ W
 
= 20° 87’ W of TN
 
= 21° 27’ W of TN
MB = 21° 27’ + 57°
  
= 77° 27’ – 79° 27’
Position/co-ordinates
Co-ordinates are a set of two numbers that indicate the exact position  
of any point on Earth. Latitude is the co-ordinate that specifies the north–
south position of a point on the Earth’s surface. Longitude is the co-
ordinate that specifies the east–west position of a point on the Earth’s 
surface.
Co-ordinates are useful as they tell us exactly where a place or landform is.
